title: Breaking Bad’s Aaron Paul is still shook over Rihanna kiss
text:
Even stars have their fangirl moments (Picture: Brian J Ritchie/Hotsauce/REX)

Aaron Paul has admitted that he was ‘stunned’ to get a kiss from his number one crush Rihanna and honestly, who can blame him.

The Breaking Bad star, who recently reprised the role of Jesse Pinkman for Netflix’s prequel movie El Camino, recalled the moment a chance run in with Drake in Paris led him to meet the pop star/beauty queen/underwear mogul.

‘The first time I met Drake I was randomly in this parking garage in Paris and I got out of my car and walked in and Drake screams out my name and I turn around and I’m like, “Oh, there’s Drake,”’ he said.

Sure Aaron, we’ve all been there.

The 40-year-old actor continued: ‘He told me that he got Rihanna in on it who I am just obsessed with, she’s my crush.

‘[Then] Rihanna jumps out and starts running in my direction. I turned, “Who is she running to, there is no one behind me” and she throws her arms around me and gives me this big hug and kisses me on the cheek and says that she loves me.’

‘I’m like, “Oh my God, I love you too! This is great!” She was like, “I just needed proof of this” and then she posed for some paparazzi and then posted this picture on Instagram, “My life has been made, Pinkman for President!”’

Listening to that story, we genuinely don’t know who we’re more jealous of.

Following the success of El Camino, some critics expressed frustration at the lack of female characters in the film, but Aaron told Metro.co.uk that it should definitely be taken as a compliment.

‘I’m sorry that you have an issue with it. But maybe take it as a compliment that all the bad people happen to be men. Right?

‘Maybe they could’ve come up with a great villain, female character, but I don’t know. Another time!’

Hey, if that means we get another sequel, we’re more than happy to wait.
